    • Method Detail

      • getBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap(android.net.Uri uri)
        Downloads an image from the internet or loads an image locally and returns a bitmap object. The image should be less than 450dp for the push notification. An aspect ratio of 2:1 is recommended. This should always be run in a background thread.

        According to http://developer.android.com/guide/appendix/media-formats.html, the supported file types are jpg and png.

        Performs no sampling of the image. For image sampling, use getBitmap(Context, Uri, AppboyViewBounds)

        Parameters:
        uri - The uri where the image is found
        Returns:
        An image in Bitmap form. If the image cannot be downloaded, found on the filesystem, or cannot be decoded into a bitmap, then null is returned.

      • getBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap(android.content.Context context,
                                                android.net.Uri uri,
                                                AppboyViewBounds viewBounds)
        See getBitmap(Uri). This will additionally perform image sampling based on the viewBounds and the source image dimensions.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context. If null, no remote bitmap sampling will occur.
        uri - The uri of the remote image.
        viewBounds - The bounds for the destination view. If null, no remote bitmap sampling will occur.
        Returns:
        A sampled bitmap if the source image is larger than the destination view dimensions.

      • getDefaultScreenDisplayMetrics

        public static android.util.DisplayMetrics getDefaultScreenDisplayMetrics(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the screen density expressed as dpi. Uses the display as provided by WindowManager.getDefaultDisplay()

      • getPixelsFromDensityAndDp

        public static int getPixelsFromDensityAndDp(int dpi,
                                            int dp)
        Parameters:
        dpi - dpi of the screen
        dp - dimension of the original image
        Returns:
        an adjusted dimension in pixels for an image for display in big image push.

      • getImageLoaderCacheSize

        public static int getImageLoaderCacheSize()
        Gets the size in bytes to give the image loader's cache.
        Returns:
        the cache size to give the image loader in bytes
